name: Upper Body — Pull-up Focus
description: A 3-day upper body program designed to build pull-up strength while developing overall upper body mass and pressing power. Rotates through bench-focused, OHP-focused, and volume days.

A.name: Upper A — Bench + Row + Pull-up Practice

B.name: Upper B — Pull-up Strength + OHP + Back

sequence.name: Perfect Singles
sequence.instruction: 8 single pull-ups with full rest. Jump-assist if needed.

C.name: Upper C — Volume + Shoulder Health + Arms

instructions.Warm-up: Dead Hang:
Setup: Grab bar shoulder-width, hang with knees bent if needed.

Do it: Hang with shoulders "set" (pulled slightly down, not jammed into ears). Keep ribs down, light brace. Breathe slowly.

Goal: Build grip strength and shoulder tolerance for pull-ups.
instructions.Warm-up: Scapular Work:
Setup: Hang from bar, elbows locked straight.

Move: Pull shoulder blades down and back (like putting them in your back pockets). Body rises slightly. Return to relaxed hang.

Key: Do NOT bend elbows. This is purely a shoulder blade movement.
instructions.Warm-up: Scapular Pull-ups:
Setup: Hang from bar, elbows locked straight.

Move: Pull shoulder blades down and back (like putting them in your back pockets). Body rises slightly. Return to relaxed hang.

Key: Do NOT bend elbows. This is purely a shoulder blade movement.
instructions.Warm-up: Scapular Push-ups:
Setup: Get in push-up position with arms straight.

Move: Let your shoulder blades come together (chest sinks slightly), then push them apart (upper back rounds slightly).

Key: Arms stay straight the whole time. Only your shoulder blades move.
instructions.Warm-up: Prone Y-T-W:
Setup: Lie face down on bench or floor. Light weights or none.

Y: Arms angled overhead like a "Y". Lift, pause 1 sec, lower.

T: Arms straight out to sides like a "T". Lift, pause, lower.

W: Elbows bent, squeeze shoulder blades down/back like making a "W".

Do 8 of each shape.
instructions.Ramp Sets:
What: 2-4 light warm-up sets for your first barbell exercise.

How: Start with empty bar, gradually increase weight each set.

Example: Empty bar → 50% → 70% → 85% of working weight.

Goal: Groove the movement pattern and prepare your muscles.

Take your time, then tap SET DONE when ready to continue.
instructions.Shoulder Health: Prone T:
Setup: Face down on bench, arms hanging straight down.

Move: Raise arms out to sides (making a T), leading with thumbs up.

Key: Squeeze shoulder blades together at top. Use light weight or none.
instructions.Shoulder Health: Prone Y:
Setup: Face down on bench, arms hanging straight down.

Move: Raise arms overhead at 45° angle (making a Y), thumbs up.

Key: Keep shoulders away from ears. Control the movement.
instructions.Shoulder Health: External Rotation:
Setup: Lie on your side. Top arm's elbow pinned to ribs, bent 90°. Hold light weight.

Move: Keeping elbow glued to side, rotate forearm upward toward ceiling.

Key: Slow and controlled. This builds rotator cuff strength.
instructions.Arms: DB Curls:
Setup: Stand tall, dumbbells at sides, palms forward.

Curl: Bend elbows to bring weights up. Keep upper arms still.

Lower: Slow and controlled back to start.
instructions.Arms: Overhead Triceps:
Setup: Hold one dumbbell or kettlebell overhead with both hands.

Lower: Bend elbows to lower weight behind head.

Press: Extend arms back to start. Keep elbows pointing up.
instructions.Cool-down: Scapular Pull-ups:
Easy practice to finish.

Same as warm-up scapular pull-ups, but keep it light and controlled.

Focus on the mind-muscle connection with your shoulder blades.
instructions.Warm-up:
Complete these in order:

1. Dead Hang - 2×15-30s. Grip the bar, hang with shoulders engaged (not shrugged to ears). Breathe slowly.

2. Scapular Pull-ups - 2×6-10. From hang, pull shoulder blades down and back without bending elbows. Small movement, big activation.

3. Scapular Push-ups - 2×8-12. In push-up position, let shoulder blades come together, then push them apart. Arms stay straight.

4. Prone Y-T-W - 1 round of 8 each. Face down, make Y/T/W shapes with arms, squeezing shoulder blades.

5. Ramp Sets - 2-4 light sets of your first barbell exercise, gradually increasing weight.
instructions.Dead Hang:
Setup: Grab bar shoulder-width, hang with knees bent if needed.

Do it: Hang with shoulders "set" (pulled slightly down, not jammed into ears). Keep ribs down, light brace. Breathe slowly.

Goal: Build grip strength and shoulder tolerance for pull-ups.
instructions.Scapular Pull-ups:
Setup: Hang from bar, elbows locked straight.

Move: Pull shoulder blades down and back (like putting them in your back pockets). Body rises slightly. Return to relaxed hang.

Key: Do NOT bend elbows. This is purely a shoulder blade movement.
instructions.Top Hold (Chin Over Bar):
Setup: Jump or step to get chin over bar.

Hold: Keep chin over bar, chest lifted, shoulders down. Hold for prescribed time.

Don't: Crank your neck up. Keep eyes forward, let back do the work.
instructions.Negative Pull-up:
Setup: Jump to top position (chin above bar). Start tight: shoulders down, abs braced.

Lower: Descend slowly for prescribed seconds. Control the entire way down. Elbows track toward ribs.

Finish: Full hang with control (don't just drop).
instructions.Mid-point Hold:
Setup: Jump to top, then lower until elbows are about 90°.

Hold: Keep shoulders down, chest tall. Hold for prescribed time.

Why: Strengthens the "sticking point" range.
instructions.Perfect Singles:
What: Single clean pull-ups with full rest between.

Do: Full hang → chin over bar → controlled lower. If you can't get chin over, do: jump to top → 2s hold → slow negative.

Rule: NEVER grind. Stop before form breaks down.
instructions.Barbell Bench Press:
Setup: Eyes under bar, feet flat behind knees, grip just wider than shoulders.

Unrack: Squeeze shoulder blades BACK and DOWN. Hold bar over mid-chest.

Lower: Bar to lower chest/sternum, elbows ~45° from torso (not flared out).

Press: Push up and slightly back toward face. Keep blades pinned.

Breathing: Big breath before lowering, hold during press, exhale at top.
instructions.Paused Bench Press:
Same as bench press, but:

Pause: After bar touches chest, hold it STILL for 1-2 seconds (no bounce), then press.

Why: Builds strength at the hardest point. Forces good positioning.
instructions.Close-Grip Bench Press:
Grip: Hands about shoulder-width (closer than regular, but not touching).

Elbows: Keep tucked ~30-45° from torso.

Goal: Triceps strength and bench lockout power.
instructions.Standing Barbell OHP:
Setup: Feet shoulder-width, bar at upper chest/clavicle, grip just outside shoulders.

Brace: Squeeze glutes, ribs down, light ab brace. Don't lean back!

Press: Bar goes up in near-vertical path. Move head back as it passes, then forward under bar at top.
instructions.Barbell Row (Pause):
Setup: Feet hip-width, hinge at hips until torso ~30-45° to floor. Neutral spine.

Row: Pull bar to lower ribs/upper stomach. Elbows back. Pause 1 second at top.

Lower: Control down. Don't jerk with lower back.

Cues: "Proud chest." "Pull elbows to hips." "No shrugging."
instructions.Barbell Row (Tempo):
Same as barbell row, but:

Tempo: Lower the bar for 3 FULL SECONDS every rep.

Why: Increases difficulty without more weight. Builds back control.
instructions.Incline Dumbbell Press:
Setup: Bench at low incline, DBs at upper chest, feet planted.

Press: Push up and slightly together. Don't bang DBs at top.

Lower: Slow, controlled, elbows ~45° from torso.
instructions.One-Arm Dumbbell Row:
Setup: One knee + hand on bench, spine long. Other hand holds DB.

Row: Pull DB toward hip. Pause 1 second at top.

Lower: Slow down, let shoulder blade stretch at bottom.

Key: Keep hips mostly square (don't twist torso).
instructions.Push-ups:
Setup: Hands under shoulders (or slightly wider). Body straight from head to heels.

Lower: Chest toward floor, elbows ~30-45° from torso.

Press: Push floor away. Keep core braced, no sagging hips.

Options: Hands on bench (easier) or feet elevated (harder).
instructions.Rear Delt Fly:
Setup: Hinge at hips, torso angled down, DBs hang below shoulders.

Move: Raise arms out to sides making a "T", slight elbow bend.

Control: Slow, strict reps. Stop before shrugging.
instructions.Lateral Raise:
Setup: Stand tall, slight elbow bend, DBs at sides.

Raise: Lift to shoulder height. Lead with elbows, not hands.

Key: No swinging. Use lighter weight if needed.
instructions.Curls:
Setup: Stand tall, elbows close to sides.

Curl: Bring weight up by bending elbows only. Don't lean back or swing.

Lower: Slow and controlled.
instructions.Hammer Curl:
Setup: Hold DBs with thumbs up (neutral grip).

Curl: Raise without rotating wrist. Elbow stays close to side.

Benefit: Trains forearms and elbow flexors for pull-up support.
instructions.Skull Crushers:
Setup: Lie on bench, hold bar above chest, elbows pointed up.

Lower: Bend elbows, bring bar toward forehead/top of head. Upper arms stay still.

Press: Extend elbows to return. Smooth and controlled.

Note: If elbows hurt, switch to close-grip bench.
instructions.Overhead Triceps Extension:
Setup: Hold one KB/DB overhead with both hands.

Lower: Bend elbows, bring weight behind head with control.

Raise: Extend elbows back to overhead. Keep ribs down.
instructions.Shoulder Health Block:
Do 2 rounds with light weight (or bodyweight):

• Prone T Raises: 12-20 reps. Face down on bench, arms out to sides, lift with shoulder blades.

• Prone Y Raises: 10-15 reps. Face down, arms in Y shape, lift slowly.

• Side-lying External Rotation: 12-20/side. Lie on side, top elbow pinned to ribs, rotate forearm up.

Goal: Control and activation, not load.
instructions.Arms Superset:
Do 3 rounds, minimal rest between exercises:

• DB Curls: 10-15 reps

• Overhead Triceps Extension: 10-15 reps

Rest 45-75 seconds between rounds.
instructions.Hanging Reinforcement:
Easy practice to reinforce pull-up mechanics:

• Dead Hang: 2×20-40 seconds

• Scapular Pull-ups: 2×6-10 reps

Keep it easy. This is groove practice, not a workout.
instructions.Rest:
Rest time.

Walk around, breathe, hydrate. Shake out your arms.

Mentally prepare for the next set.
instructions.Finish:
Great work!

Hydrate, do some easy shoulder circles.

Consider noting your main lift weights for next time.
